comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This is interesting, because at the moment we must assume that Bryan is standing at the podium in the centre background stage.  Yet, many people closer tot he camera are looking to the right rear of the camera.  Possibly more than one speaker's podium at this event.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Bain's photo bears the date April 20, 1912. The venue is the "cottage" in New York City's Union Square. A story in The New York Times on the following day reported that Bryan had addressed a large crowd of Columbia University students at Horace Mann Auditorium. The New York Times, April 21, 1912: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9E0DEEDD1E3CE6... Bryan was in New York City as a delegate to the "Men in Religion Forward Convention," and stayed at the Hotel Astor, according to an item in The New York Times, April 22, 1912: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9E01EFDA1F31E2...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A new Bain/LOC Flickr posting (November 12, 2010) of a Suffragette rally on May 2, 1914, gives a better view of the background structure and identifies this scene as Union Square, New York City:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5169603438/]

On April 27, 2011, the LOC posted this Bain photo of Union Square's cottage, taken during a workers' rally on May Day (May 1), 1914:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5669473837/in/photostream]
